Index.title: The Fjord of the Balkans
Index.description: Experience the majestic Komani Lake and Shala River with the original local pioneers.
Index.metaTitle: Komani Lake Tours | The Majestic Fjord of the Balkans
Index.metaDescription: Discover the wild heart of Albania with the original explorers of these fjords. Guided boat tours, Shala River exploration, and local mountain hospitality.

FeaturedTour.title: The Komani Lake
FeaturedTour.subtitle: Boat Tour Experience
FeaturedTour.description: Sail through the 'Fjords of the Balkans' for an unforgettable 11-hour journey. Departing daily from Shkoder, this all-inclusive tour takes you through the majestic Molla Valley, with stops for swimming, kayaking, and a traditional lunch at a secluded riverside village.

Tours.customRequest: Custom group tours and private expeditions available upon request.
Tours.addonsDesc: Essential services to complete your journey.

WhyChooseUs.title: Why Journey
WhyChooseUs.subtitle: With Us?
WhyChooseUs.description: We don't just provide tours; we offer a connection to the wild heart of Albania, led by the people who know it best.

usp1.title: The Original Pioneers
usp1.description: Founded by Mario Molla, the first guide to bring tourism to Komani Lake. Our knowledge is rooted in generations of local heritage.

usp2.title: Eco-Conscious Travel
usp2.description: We lead lake cleanup efforts and promote sustainable tourism. Every booking supports the conservation of the 'Fjord of the Balkans'.

usp3.title: Safety & Reliability
usp3.description: Certified captains, fully insured vessels, and modern safety gear. Your safety is our absolute priority on every journey.

usp4.title: Authentic Hospitality
usp4.description: Stay in traditional mountain homes (Kullas) and eat organic food prepared by local families. Experience the real Albania.

AboutParallax.title: Meet Mario Molla
AboutParallax.subtitle: Guardian of the Lake
AboutParallax.quote: "I was born in these mountains, and I've spent my life navigating these waters. My mission isn't just to show you the lake, but to protect it."

narrative.title: It started with a single wooden boat in 2010
narrative.p1: Long before Komani Lake was on every traveler's bucket list, Mario Molla was navigating these waters as a local fisherman and guide. Born and raised in the surrounding mountains, he saw the untapped beauty of the fjords and the need for a sustainable way to share them with the world.
narrative.p2: Most operators view Komani as a transit point. We view it as a living ecosystem. In 2010, we launched Komani Lake Tours with one goal: to protect the environment while providing authentic, local-led experiences that contribute directly to our mountain communities.
narrative.p3: The Molla family has lived by these waters for generations. Our deep connection to the land is celebrated through our local traditions and Christian heritage, with community gatherings almost every month.

conservation.title: Conservation
conservation.text: We lead seasonal lake cleanup projects and promote 'zero-trace' tourism.

heritage.title: Heritage
heritage.text: Every guide is a local from the lake's villages, preserving our oral history.

community.title: Community
community.text: 100% of our supplies and food are sourced from mountain farmhouses.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.text: Honest pricing, certified safety, and the original local experience.

Gallery.title: A Visual Journey
Gallery.subtitle: Discover the 'Thailand of Albania'. Every corner of Koman Lake and Shala River tells a story of wild nature and ancient heritage.

Testimonials.title: Stories from
Testimonials.subtitle: Our Guests
Testimonials.description: Join thousands of travelers who have discovered the magic of Komani Lake with us.

Faq.title: Common
Faq.subtitle: Questions
Faq.description: Everything you need to know before you sail.

q1.q: Where does the ferry depart from?
q1.a: The ferry departs from the Koman Terminal. We recommend arriving at least 30 minutes before departure. If you are driving from Shkoder, allow about 2 hours for the drive as the road can be winding.

q2.q: Can I bring my car on the ferry?
q2.a: Yes, our ferry 'Berisha' accommodates cars, campers, and motorcycles. However, space is limited, so advanced booking is highly recommended, especially in high season (July-August).

q3.q: Is lunch included in the boat tours?
q3.a: Yes! Our daily boat tours include a traditional lunch at a local guesthouse by the river, featuring fresh fish, homemade bread, and local cheese.

q4.a: Currently, we accept cash (Euro or LEK) upon arrival. We are working on integrating online payments soon. You will receive a confirmation voucher via email after booking.

q5.q: Is the trip suitable for children?
q5.a: Absolutely! The boat ride is smooth and safe. We provide life jackets for all ages. The Shala River is also calm and perfect for families.

hero.title: Guardians of
hero.subtitle: The Fjord.
hero.description: We don't just clear the plastic. We are building a culture of preservation for the Shala River and Komani Lake ecosystem.

mission.quote: "Nature is not a commodity. It is our home."
mission.description: Since 2010, Komani Lake Tours has led the initiative to keep our waters clean. In a region where waste management is a developing challenge, we take it upon ourselves to perform daily cleanups, educate visitors, and support local families to maintain traditional, low-impact lifestyles.

zeroTrace.title: Zero Trace Policy
zeroTrace.text: We carry out everything we bring in. Our boats are equipped with waste separation bins, and we actively collect floating debris during every tour.

community.title: Community Empowerment
community.text: We employ 100% local guides and captains. Your ticket directly supports families in the remote villages of Dukagjin who rely on sustainable tourism.

preservation.title: Cultural Preservation
preservation.text: We restore traditional "Kulla" stone houses and keep ancient maritime routes alive, ensuring the history of the lake is strictly preserved.

cta.title: Join Our Next Cleanup
cta.description: We organize monthly volunteer cleanup expeditions. Join us for a free tour in exchange for a helping hand.

gallery.img1: Community volunteers working together to preserve the lake's beauty.

gallery.img6: Crystal clear waters protected by sustainable tourism practices.

ContactPage.subtitle: Touch.
ContactPage.description: Have questions about transfers, private tours, or local stays? We're here to help you plan the perfect journey.

Footer.story: Experience the majestic beauty of Albania's fjords with the original local pioneers.

notes.title: Note:
notes.text: Komani Lake weather can change quickly. We recommend bringing a light jacket even in summer. Cash (EUR/LEK) is required for additional personal expenses during the trip.

sidebar.skipLine: Skip the line at Koman Terminal
sidebar.noFees: No hidden fees · Free cancellation up to 48h

boat-tour.title: Komani Lake Boat Tour
boat-tour.description: Everyday organized traditional boat tours. Departing daily from our spots in Shkoder at 7am. Boat tour starts at 9am. Sail through the fjords for about 1.5 hours toward Molla valley and river. Lunch break at village. Free time exploring around, kayaking, trekking, swimming and fishing till 3pm. Take boat back to return to Shkoder. Arrival in Shkoder approx 6pm.
boat-tour.summary: 11 Hours · Transfers, Boat Tours, Coffee Break & Snack included

itinerary.activity: Departing daily from our spots in Shkoder

shkoder-valbona.title: Shkoder - Valbona Transfer
shkoder-valbona.description: Transform your transit into an adventure. Our daily Shkoder-Valbona service combines the efficiency of a direct transfer with the breathtaking beauty of the Komani Lake ferry. Ideal for hikers and explorers, this route offers the most spectacular introduction to the Albanian Alps, surrounding you with towering cliffs and crystal-clear waters.

local-experience.title: The Local Experience
local-experience.description: Local exploring for 2 or 3 days. Discover old villages, local cuisine, old tracks and traces of ancestry DNA — a hard life sculpted in the old Kullas built with high precision. Experience peak hikes about 1250m above sea level. Mule riding and fishing days are also arrangeable.
local-experience.summary: 2-3 Days · €100 (2 days) or €130 (3 days) · Transfers, Meals, Accommodation included

kayak-rental.title: Kayak & Solo Adventure
kayak-rental.description: Rent a kayak and explore the hidden corners of the Shala River at your own pace. Discover secret beaches accessible only by small boats, paddle through the silent fjords, and find your own private slice of paradise.
kayak-rental.summary: Flexible Timing · Professional Gear · Maps & Safety Briefing included

itinerary.activity: Pick up at Blini Park or Shala River
Rent by hour or full day

helicopter-tour.title: Helicopter Sky Cruise
helicopter-tour.description: In collaboration with Viva Air Albania. Fly from Tirana to the Alps, soaring over the Riviera, canyons, and Komani Lake. Optional lunch stop at Shala River.
helicopter-tour.summary: Flexible · Private Aerial Tour · Riviera & Alps views included

custom-tour.title: Custom Tour
custom-tour.description: Tailor your own adventure. Private boat, specific route, or special event - we make it happen.
custom-tour.summary: Tailored Itinerary · Private Boat & Guide · Custom Experience

itinerary.activity: Your choice of departure and destinations

Reviews.name: Miri D
Reviews.title: Wow Wow Wow!!
Reviews.text: One of our highlights in Albania. Outstanding! We went by the tour company of Mario Molla... We booked the ECO tour which included a pick up and drive back to Shkoder, a lunch, 2 swimming spots, the boat ride. We enjoyed every second of it. The scenery is just magical. Make sure to go under the week, because its very crowded on weekends.

Reviews.name: John B
Reviews.title: A beautiful place - an interesting experience
Reviews.text: We decided to book our tour with Mario Molla. Mario's family has lived in the area for generations and is truly passionate for the region. For 35 euros Mario will arrange for pick up in downtown Shkoder and get you to the lake and back plus a four hour excursion. Lunch is included and is provided at a family's home with a great view of the lake... grilled lamb, grilled sausages, home-made cheese, salad and all the rakia.

Reviews.name: JSLsc
Reviews.title: A very efficient way to travel
Reviews.text: I travelled from Shkodra to Valbona by way of the Lake Komani ferry. The boat was comfortable and the views were amazing. I used Mario Molla Boat Tours which was unbelievably efficient. They arranged to pick me up at my hotel in Shkodra... It was easy, enjoyable and the price was very reasonable. I highly recommend both Komani Lake and Mario Molla Boat Tours.

Reviews.name: Helena L
Reviews.title: Komani Lake - Mario Molla
Reviews.text: Wonderful place! The boat trip was delightful. Very good food and received a very warm welcome by the staff.

Reviews.name: arniearn
Reviews.title: A really nice trip - a highlight of the Balkans
Reviews.text: The tour run by Mario Molla was awesome, however, including a stop at the family house on the lake for lunch. Highly recommended! The ride from Shkoder took two hours each way on some pretty bad roads, but it was worth it.

Reviews.name: Shaun R
Reviews.title: Amazing Scenery
Reviews.text: What was good was the amazing hills, reflections and the local lunch. We loved swimming up the river and off the pontoon from our local lunch. All in all, the quality of the scenery out weighed the bad points and I would be recommending the trip.

Reviews.name: PAULLFWOOD
Reviews.title: A very nice boat/ferry trip
Reviews.text: Mario Molla seems to be the only person who organises any of the various Lake Koman... We used him for our tour and everything went according to plan. It was a very nice day and well worth the trip.

Reviews.name: Nancy V
Reviews.title: How to travel to/from Koman Lake
Reviews.text: It's REALLY WORTH doing this trip !!!! There is a private boat tour with Mario Molla. Mario Molla also offers further transport.

Reviews.name: tadejkirincic
Reviews.title: Awesome and unforgettable boat trip
Reviews.text: Nature and mountains surrounding the lake are really beautiful... I went on the boat trip with Mario Molla, which was well organised. We got an apple and a beer as a breakfast. Boat trip with him costed 20 EUR (motorcycle included).

Reviews.name: Jethro672
Reviews.title: Spectacular - one of the highlights
Reviews.text: This was certainly a 5 star highlight. The natural beauty, colours, geology and peacefulness... I took a trip with Mario Molla from Shkoder. We stopped at a restaurant on the other side of the dam - which was excellent.

Reviews.name: Alex D
Reviews.title: Fantastic tour of Lake Koman
Reviews.text: Google 'Mario Molla' for details. Amazing views, great service. Had a lovely ride along to where the river splits off - stopped at Mario's family home (what a location on the lake!) for pancakes and a chat with his family. Highly recommended!

Reviews.name: Tiruva
Reviews.title: Boat tour on Komani Lake
Reviews.text: We went there with Mario Molla who organizes boat trips on the lake. He is really helpful and tries to do everything that you have a perfect boat trip. It was our best experience in Albania so far. I would always come back and do it again!

Reviews.name: Paul H
Reviews.title: Captivating Lake Komani
Reviews.text: Mario Molla is a local entrepreneur offering a helpful and friendly alternative to the public ferry and will organise pick up from Shkodra and onward travel from Fierze as part of his 'package'.
